what: Using gpt-4o-mini to condense an example report
title: llm4np: language modeling for neuropsychology reports
text: retrieved example PDF neuropsychological (NP) evaluation thepeerconsult.com. parse_nppdf uses pdftools tabulapdf extract text tables reports. paste report text single character vector convenient processing. also view autism ontology based 2015 paper Alexa McCray colleages. Now create agent prompted use ontology summary NP evaluation. now use templated prompt, using report text ontology summary. George Smith, highly gifted 12-year-old, faces challenges social skills, executive functioning, emotional regulation, affecting overall potential. Diagnosed Autism Spectrum Disorder Level 1 (PTO:Primary Diagnosis), ADHD (PTO:Attention Deficit Disorder Hyperactivity), anxiety (PTO:Anxiety), requires tailored support. remarkable strengths include superior verbal nonverbal problem-solving abilities (PTO:Cognitive Ability), alongside exceptional verbal memory (PTO:Working Memory) strong language skills. attributes facilitate understanding communication interacting structured clear information. Nevertheless, George exhibits weaknesses motor skills (PTO:Fine Motor Skills), processing speed (PTO:Task Performance), emotional regulation (PTO:Emotional Regulation Control). difficulty transitions challenges social reciprocity hinder ability connect peers despite intelligence (PTO:Social Competence). support George, ongoing interventions focusing emotional development (PTO:Emotional Regulation Control), social skills training (PTO:Social Competence), executive functioning crucial. structured predictable learning environment (PTO:Planning) help nurture strengths addressing areas need. evaluation indicates George significantly benefit continued occupational therapy (PTO:Motor Skills) participation social skills groups (PTO:Engaging Social Activities), fostering engagement peers can practice refine social skills. Strengths include: Cognitive Ability (PTO:Cognitive Ability), Working Memory (PTO:Working Memory), Social Competence (PTO:Social Competence), Emotional Regulation Control (PTO:Emotional Regulation Control). Weaknesses include: Fine Motor Skills (PTO:Fine Motor Skills), Task Performance (PTO:Task Performance), Emotional Regulation Control (PTO:Emotional Regulation Control), Social Competence (PTO:Social Competence). Needs include: Primary Diagnosis (PTO:Primary Diagnosis), Attention Deficit Disorder Hyperactivity (PTO:Attention Deficit Disorder Hyperactivity), Motor Skills (PTO:Motor Skills), Engaging Social Activities (PTO:Engaging Social Activities).
code: library(wizrd) library(llm4np) pretty_rmd <- function(x) {     x |> strwrap() |> paste(">", text = _, collapse = "\n") |> cat() } nelsonasd = system.file("pdfs", "nelsonAutDeid.pdf", package="llm4np") nels = parse_nppdf(nelsonasd) ## Error : '4.  Educators are also likely to be best able to support George’s emotional, behavioral, and social functioning' does not exist in current working directory ('/Users/vincentcarey/AUTISM/llm4np/vignettes'). ## Error : '    ognitive Skills             ' does not exist in current working directory ('/Users/vincentcarey/AUTISM/llm4np/vignettes'). nels ## Parsed NP pdf with 14 pages and 5 tables. nt = gsub("\\n", " ", paste(nels@text, collapse=" ")) substr(nt, 1, 35) ## [1] "                                   " data(nmdf) head(nmdf) ##         tag                                           val ## 1 Class_634                 Obstetric Delivery Procedures ## 2 Class_385                             Perinatal History ## 3 Class_464 Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity ## 4 Class_455                              Mental Disorders ## 5 Class_689                   Psychiatric Hospitalization ## 6 Class_138                       Psychologic Indications ag = openai_agent("gpt-4o-mini") |>     instruct("You are a helpful assistant with training in neuropsychology.") ag ## <wizrd::Agent> gpt-4o-mini ## @instructions: You are a helpful assistant with training in neuropsychology. ## @io: <wizrd::PlainTextFormat> → ← <wizrd::PlainTextFormat> ## @tools:  ## @params:  ## @backend: <wizrd::OpenAIAPIServer> https://api.openai.com prompted_agent <- ag |> prompt_as("Please summarize the text {txt} in five short paragraphs      of at most 45 words.  Use the      concepts in the 'val' field of {df} as much as possible, choosing the     most specific term that is relevant, and when     you do use these terms, please append the associated value of the 'tag' field     in parentheses, prefixing the tag with 'PTO:'.  After producing the paragraphs,     please produce three lists of tags that were used, corresponding to      'strengths', 'weaknesses' and 'needs'.  Do not use headings with the lists, just provide     the lists as sentences preceded by the category.")  prompted_agent |> predict(list(txt=nt, df=nmdf)) |> pretty_rmd()

what: A second example, no autism diagnosis present
title: llm4np: language modeling for neuropsychology reports
text: Joe 8-year-old boy history premature birth, Tourette syndrome, ADHD. current neuropsychological evaluation aimed clarify cognitive behavioral functioning, increased concerns attention academic progress arisen since last evaluation age 6. Joe notably engaged cooperative struggles attention regulation, negatively impacts school performance learning. Test results revealed Joe’s cognitive abilities borderline range, challenges attention executive function affecting task performance. Despite improvements since last evaluation, enhanced verbal skills, Joe continues show deficits working memory, task organization, fine motor skills. performance particularly affected complex tasks demand simultaneous operations. Parents teachers observe Joe made progress social interactions fewer hyperactive behaviors past. However, attention problems remain persistent, evidenced difficulties task initiation maintaining focus, significantly affect learning daily activities. Sleep issues behavioral concerns also persist, prompting need intervention strategies. Recommendations suggest continued small-group instructional support, daily practice routines, use external modeling Joe. Incorporating breaks, preferential seating, ensuring structured manageable workloads critical creating conducive learning environment. Regular check-ins teachers can assist Joe staying focused class. overall impression indicates Joe remains risk ongoing academic functional difficulties, necessitating collaborative efforts among medical, educational, familial support systems. follow-assessment advised two years monitor progress. Strengths: Engaging cooperative, verbal skills, social interactions, reduction hyperactivity. Weaknesses: Attention regulation, working memory deficits, organizational skills, fine motor skills. Needs: Small-group instructional support, routine practice, breaks tasks, collaborative support educational medical teams.
code: sqspf = system.file("pdfs", "de-identified+report+1.pdf", package="llm4np") sq = parse_nppdf(sqspf) txt2 = gsub("\\n", " ", paste(sq@text, collapse=" "))  # concatenate text prompted_agent |> predict(list(txt=txt2, df=nmdf)) |> pretty_rmd()
